alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 1:27PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern West Baton Rouge, central Iberville and south central East Baton Rouge Parishes through 200 PM CDT... At 127 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bayou Sorrel, or 9 miles west of Plaquemine, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Plaquemine, Addis, Brusly, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Bayou Sorrel and Gardere. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 138 and 143. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge
